intro: Bubroma guasuma, commonly known as the Guasuma tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The tree is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters.
